name: Hilton Garden Inn New Orleans French Quarter/CBD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed overnight at the HGI CBD/French Quarter on December 30, 2007 and was pleasantly surprised with our accomodations given our rate of $84 plus $26 for parking. The size of our standard king room was exceptionally large by New Orleans standards and comparable to what you find in new construction HGI's around the country. The hotel is a conversion and not very welcoming from the street level entrance which is a parking garage. However, once you reach the lobby via the elevator to the 9th floor, you know you are in an HGI with the exception of a much larger common area than most. I can attest to the earlier reviews that the location is both quiet and convenient. In fact, Harrahs is only four blocks and the French Quarter maybe three. The pool area on the roof provides a nice view of the city and the smallesh fitness center overlooking the terrace is a nice touch. There is very litte wear on this hotel at least on the surface. What a deal for $84 and in New Orleans during peak nights a deal for at least twice that. Oh, did I mention they threw in free breakfast for my wife and I given my Gold Hilton HHonors status?
reviews.title: Great Deal for New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only problem we experienced was a fussy thermostat that resulted in us waking to a warmer than desired room. After fooling with it a while, things cooled off. Not a big deal to this frequent traveler who has experienced his share of problem temperature controls in hotels costing 3 to 4 times as much.
reviews.title: Good Hotel

likes.liked: — Large, Clean Room, Close to French Quarter, Good Value

reviews.text: This hotel is great for a weekend stay. We had a large, clean room.
reviews.title: Great Getaway
Very Good
reviews.text: It is not a luxury hotel but this was fine for us because we were not spending a lot of time in the hotel. There is a great view of the city from the pool at the top of the hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this for business travelers as well.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at Hilton Garden Inn

likes.liked: — Closeness to the French quarter, casino, and Riverwalk
likes.disliked: — No close options for breakfast other than hotel--but had other plans anyway

reviews.text: An excellent hotel although the location is a little misleading. The property is actually in the central business district about 1-2 blocks from canal street which is the western edge of the French quarter. I felt safe in this area and it was a bit of a hike to the converntion center, my place of business at the time. The hotel lobby is located on the 12th floor which is a bit odd but it works.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, good location

likes.disliked: — I could do without the 12th floor lobby if I had to change anything

reviews.text: The rooms were clean and the buffet breakfast with omlet station is just fine. I would stay there again.
reviews.title: A not so bad hotel in new orleans

reviews.text: I just was in this hotel for a week. Overall, I would say it's an "averagely nice" place to stay in New Orleans.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.text: On the positive side, the rooms are quite big, well equipped and clean. The beds are nice and comfortable. The room had a small fridge as well as a microwave oven (although I used none of them). Also, the hotel is quite conveniently located, very close but not inside the (noisy) French quarter. The staff at the reception was professional and efficient.
reviews.title: Good, but don't eat here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However, everything was not perfect. First, the internet connection was *amazingly* slow. Both wired and wireless connectivity was available, and both were slow. Moreover, the wireless signal was very weak in most of the room. Food taken at the hotel's restaurant was really "average" and the restaurant staff was really painfully slow.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.text: I recently stayed here over the weekend with my teenage son and adult niece. Good location - only a few blocks walk to the heart of Bourbon street. We got a great rate when we booked on the website. The rooms are large - there was plenty of space for the 3 of us. Beds are very comfortable. The entire hotel - lobby, hallways and rooms were all clean - looked almost new. It was so quiet it was hard to tell if there were other guests on our floor. Housekeeping was great - you couldn't tell they were on the floor until you saw their cart. We went out on Saturday a.m. and when we returned, in addition to cleaning our room houskeeping had neatly lined our shoes along the wall, placed our toothbrushes in a glass and organized our toiletries on the bathroom counter. We did eat breakfast at the grill there - buffet is $10.95 - and they make omelets, pancakes, french toast, etc. to order. The staff there is very friendly and attentive. Also this is one of very few hotels there that offer free high speed internet in the room. I would recommend this hotel for a great stay that is close enough but not in the Quarter.
reviews.title: Great stay at the Garden Inn

reviews.text: Hotel is a nice quiet almost hidden gem. Stayed here for 2nd weekend of jazzfest. Easy walk to Harrahs, stinky bourbon st., plenty of cabs drive by, friendly staff, nice free breakfast (diamond hhonors benny) , room always made up nice when I returned, small pool but had it all for rmyself - just right. Small little bar for a quick drink and good bartender. I'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Stay during Jazzfest

reviews.text: I visit New Orleans often and when I do I usually stay at a Hilton property being that I'm a HHonors Member. This was my first visit to this particular property. Check -In was fine. Breakfast was outstanding. Lunch was just as good. I especially enjoyed the Ribeye Steak. There were some problems with my room. Fridge was unstable. Room not very Clean. No safe in room. No remote for TV. Parking at this Hotel is just plain horrible. Valet takes forever and Self Parking is almost impossible with any vehicle larger than a ford taurus.
reviews.title: Back in New Orleans

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We choose the Hilton Garden Inn as our pre-cruise hotel. Everything about the hotel was to our liking. Check-in was a breeze; the rooms were clean and spacious. Internet was free. And, of course, the hotel was a short walk from the French Quarter and the Riverfront. My only disappointment with the hotel was the fact that the fitness facility was small and many of the machines were broken and the outdoor heated pool was filled with dirt and debris. Other than that the hotel was great and we will definitely be staying here again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel!
